pesticide.PPE: Coveralls over short-sleeved shirt and short pants; Chemical-resistant gloves, such as barrier laminate, nitrile rubber > 14 mils, or viton > 14 mils; Chemical-resistant footwear plus socks; Protective eyewear; Chemical-resistant apron when cleaning equipment, mixing, and loading

Safety_Information.general_Info: Causes substantial but temporary eye injury. Causes skin irritation. Harmful if absorbed through skin or swallowed. DO NOT get in eyes, on skin, or on clothing.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eyes open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after first 5 minutes; then continue rinsing eyes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Immediately call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice. DO NOT give any liquid to the person. DO NOT induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. DO NOT give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15 to 20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance; then give artificial respiration, preferably by mouth to mouth, if possible. Call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Contains petroleum distillate. Probable mucosal damage may contraindicate the use of gastric lavage. Vomiting may cause aspiration pneumonia.
